dataSource.name: Playground
dataSource.source: {"type":"FeatureCollection","features":[{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Stepping Sounds","looping_sound":"looping_steppingSounds","short_sound":"short_steppingSounds","intro_sound":"intro_steppingSounds","description":"The stepping sounds are a permanent installation placed at the main entrance to the playground. The stepping sounds make different sounds as users walk in front of hidden sensors placed along the side of the walkway. There are several different sounds including water and squeaky shoes.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[3,10],[3,11],[5,11],[7,8],[3,10]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Disk Spinner","looping_sound":"looping_diskSpinner","short_sound":"short_diskSpinner","intro_sound":"intro_diskSpinner","description":"The disk spinner may seem like a basic spinner, but of all the spinners at Magical Bridge it can offer the most thrilling and challenging spinning experience. The disk spinner almost looks like an enormous thumbtack that isnâ€™t put in the ground perfectly straight.   The disk is around 5 feet in diameter.    On one side it is 1 foot off the ground and on the highest side it is 3 feet off the ground. So not only will you rotate when you are on the disk spinner, but you will go up and down. Users can sit or lay on the disk, or for a more challenging adventure, stand on the disk and rotate it by walking. The disk spinner is 12 inches high on one side, which is a bit high to transfer from a wheelchair so it would be good to have some assistance to do it.  Even those who canâ€™t move much or at all could be lifted and placed on the disk spinner for an enjoyable spin ride.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[23,21],[23,26],[28,26],[28,21],[23,21]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Ground Carousel","looping_sound":"looping_groundCarousel","short_sound":"short_groundCarousel","intro_sound":"intro_groundCarousel","description":"The Ground Carousel is flush with the ground so everyone can ride. For those who are blind or with other challenging visual impairments, approach the ground carousel with caution.  The ground carousel has metal poles that can come around very fast and sometimes people spin with their legs and arms extended out from the carousel. So best if you are visually impaired to ask folks to stop the 1carousel before approaching it.  The carousel has two benches for up to 3 people each to sit on while riding the carousel and also has two magical parking spaces for wheelchairs. To transfer a wheelchair onto the ground carousel simply lift the safety rail, roll into the space provided and park the wheelchair.  Set the safety break on the wheelchair, then bring the safety rail down. If you have the arm strength to do it, you can â€œturnâ€ the disk in the middle of the spinner which will cause the whole carousel to rotate.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[24,15],[24,20],[28,20],[28,15],[24,15]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Net Spinner","looping_sound":"looping_netSpinner","short_sound":"short_netSpinner","intro_sound":"intro_netSpinner","description":"The Net Spinner is a combined climbing experience and a spinning experience. The structure of the Net Spinner is a large cone shaped net.  The net is anchored at the bottom to a large horizontal disk about 8 feet in diameter and about 1 foot from the ground.  Coming up from the center of the disk is pole that is 12 feet.  A network of ropes is attached from the top of the pole to the outside edge of the disks to form a net that can be climbed on.  A person standing next to the net spinner can push on the ropes in a circular direction causing the entire net spinner to rotate. Many people can climb on the net or sit safely on the disk inside at once. Not only is the net spinner a climbing challenge but you will get some good stimulus to your balance (vestibular) system if someone rotates the net spinning while you are at the top. Keep in mind the whole thing can spin as you are at a height of 8 or more feet off the ground. How do you know if you are ready to climb to the top of the net spinner?  People should be comfortable with climbing short distances up and down the net before going to the top.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[18,27],[18,32],[23,32],[23,27],[18,27]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Nest Spinner","looping_sound":"looping_nestSpinner","short_sound":"short_nestSpinner","intro_sound":"intro_nestSpinner","description":"The Nest Spinner is a relaxing spin ride where one or two people curl up safely into the nest and spin slowly and rhythmically making it a good introduction to spinning for those who would find it challenging.  The structure of the Nest Spinner looks like two large rings that are both crossed in space and connected together (be careful not to bump your head on the rings).  The base of the two rings has a cupped area which is big enough for two people to sit and a constant push on the sides of the rings to cause the nest to rotate.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[19,21],[19,24],[22,24],[22,21],[19,21]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Cozy Coccoon","looping_sound":"looping_cozyCoccoon","short_sound":"short_cozyCoccoon","intro_sound":"intro_cozyCoccoon","description":"The Cozy Cocoon is a place for kids and adults, especially those with autism and sensory challenges, to hang out in when active play feels overwhelming and frenetic. The Cozy Cocoon in the Spin Zone is one of three located throughout the playground. A Cozy Cocoon is shaped like a large sphere with openings. There is one large opening in the front with room for one person to sit down in the cocoon, and there are smaller openings in the side and back of each cocoon to use as  a window to peer out at the playground.  The cocoon can be gently rotated so that the user or a helper can  rotate it away from the action and noise. A cocoon's main purpose is to be a calming, cozy place to regroup while observing from the round openings in the cocoon and to re-emerge and re-engage in active play when ready.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[18,16],[18,18],[21,18],[21,16],[18,16]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Bench","looping_sound":"looping_bench","short_sound":"short_bench","intro_sound":"intro_bench","description":"","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[26,14],[28,14],[28,13],[26,13],[26,14]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Avas Bridge","looping_sound":"looping_avasBridge","short_sound":"short_avasBridge","intro_sound":"intro_avasBridge","description":null,"type":"walkway"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[28,25],[30,27],[32.5,16],[28.8,15],[28,25]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Long Ramp","looping_sound":"looping_longRamp","short_sound":"short_longRamp","intro_sound":"intro_longRamp","description":"The long ramp is around 90 feet long. It goes along the bottom edge of the playground. It starts at avas bridge and ends at the creak bridge.","type":"walkway"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[65,27.5],[67.5,24.5],[60,23],[29,13],[32.5,17],[58,25],[65,27.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Creek Bridge","looping_sound":"looping_creekBridge","short_sound":"short_creekBridge","intro_sound":"intro_creekBridge","description":"The creak bridge is the entrance from Mitchel park and exits on the right side in front of the tennis courts. The bridge goes over Adobe creak which flows around the edges of the playground.","type":"walkway"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[65,27.5],[74,34],[75.5,30],[67.5,24.5],[65,27.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Rock Benches","looping_sound":"looping_rockBenches","short_sound":"short_rockBenches","intro_sound":"intro_rockBenches","description":"There is no description for this item","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[33.5,19],[34.5,19],[34.5,20],[33.5,20],[33.5,19]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Play House First Floor","looping_sound":"looping_playHouseFirstFloor","short_sound":"short_playHouseFirstFloor","intro_sound":"intro_playHouseFirstFloor","description":"The playhouse is a wooden structure with 2 levels. The first floor has a cafe in the top right corner and a set of work tools in the bottom right corner. The first floor has an opening on the right side to the stage.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[48.8,29.8],[53,32.8],[57.3,25.8],[52.3,23.8],[48.8,29.8]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Kinder Bells","looping_sound":"looping_kinderBells","short_sound":"short_kinderBells","intro_sound":"intro_kinderBells","description":"Kinder bells are a series of bells that one can ring by pulling rapidly on the rope handles.  Each rope hands has a golf ball attached which serves as a striker to ring the bells. The bells are attached to an ornamental metal structure that looks like stems and leaves and the bells themselves look like large flowers.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[5.5,20.25],[5.75,20.75],[7.25,19.75],[6.9,19.25],[5.5,20.25]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Climbing Giraffe","looping_sound":"looping_climbingGiraffe","short_sound":"short_climbingGiraffe","intro_sound":"intro_climbingGiraffe","description":"The Climbing Giraffe is a small structure perfect for toddlers.  It has tactile elements, a short climbing net and bench designed to be climbed on and under. The structure looks like a Giraffe with its neck curved to the ground.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[10,21.5],[11.1,22.5],[12.1,21.5],[10.9,20.4],[10,21.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Rocking Horse","looping_sound":"looping_rockingHorse","short_sound":"short_rockingHorse","intro_sound":"intro_rockingHorse","description":"A very short rocking horse for toddlers. Be careful and use your cane as the rocking horse is about 2 feet high.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[12.5,24.4],[12.6,24.8],[13.25,24.7],[13.2,24.25],[12.5,24.4]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Mini Bench","looping_sound":"looping_miniBench","short_sound":"short_miniBench","intro_sound":"intro_miniBench","description":"","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[10.2,26.5],[10.2,27],[11.9,27],[11.9,26.5],[10.2,26.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Mini Slide","looping_sound":"looping_miniSlide","short_sound":"short_miniSlide","intro_sound":"intro_miniSlide","description":"","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[6.1,23.75],[5.6,25],[6.5,25.4],[7,24],[6.1,23.75]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Cozy Coccoon","looping_sound":"looping_cozyCoccoon","short_sound":"short_cozyCoccoon","intro_sound":"intro_cozyCoccoon","description":"The Cozy Cocoon is a place for kids and adults, especially those with autism and sensory challenges, to hang out in when active play feels overwhelming and frenetic. The Cozy Cocoon in the Spin Zone is one of three located throughout the playground. A Cozy Cocoon is shaped like a large sphere with openings. There is one large opening in the front with room for one person to sit down in the cocoon, and there are smaller openings in the side and back of each cocoon to use as  a window to peer out at the playground.  The cocoon can be gently rotated so that the user or a helper can  rotate it away from the action and noise. A cocoon's main purpose is to be a calming, cozy place to regroup while observing from the round openings in the cocoon and to re-emerge and re-engage in active play when ready.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[7,43.75],[7,45],[8.5,45],[8.5,43.75],[7,43.75]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Walking Machine","looping_sound":"looping_walkingMachine","short_sound":"short_walkingMachine","intro_sound":"intro_walkingMachine","description":"There is no description for this item","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[18.5,55],[18.75,55.25],[19.25,54.4],[19,54.2],[18.5,55]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Exercise Bike","looping_sound":"looping_exerciseBike","short_sound":"short_exerciseBike","intro_sound":"intro_exerciseBike","description":"There is no description for this item","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[18.4,51.3],[20.25,53],[20.5,52.5],[18.7,50.9],[18.4,51.3]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Bench","looping_sound":"looping_bench","short_sound":"short_bench","intro_sound":"intro_bench","description":"","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[6.5,55],[6,55.6],[7.5,56.6],[7.75,56.25],[6.5,55]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Bench","looping_sound":"looping_bench","short_sound":"short_bench","intro_sound":"intro_bench","description":"","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[16.5,56.75],[17,57.25],[18,56],[17.5,55.5],[16.5,56.75]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Bucket Swings","looping_sound":"looping_bucketSwings","short_sound":"short_bucketSwings","intro_sound":"intro_bucketSwings","description":"Bucket and Disk Swings are supportive, allowing for use by all abilities, and promote collaborative swinging.  The bucket swings have a rigid plastic harness with a metal latching mechanism to keep the rider secure when swinging.  The harness hinges are located near the rider shoulders and the whole harness rotates overhead.  Be careful to not hit your head on the harness when getting in and out of the bucket swings.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[6,48],[14.25,55.5],[14.5,55.25],[6.25,47.5],[6,48]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Disk Swings","looping_sound":"looping_diskSwings","short_sound":"short_diskSwings","intro_sound":"intro_diskSwings","description":"Bucket and Disk Swings are supportive, allowing for use by all abilities, and promote collaborative swinging. The disk swing is an entertaining spot for you to  relax and be swung. It is recommended that people, especially with visual impairments, be careful of their heads. The disk swing is a disk that fits several people and can be pushed back and forth.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[10,39.5],[10.5,39.5],[8,31.5],[7.5,31.5],[10,39.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Sway Fun","looping_sound":"looping_swayFun","short_sound":"short_swayFun","intro_sound":"intro_swayFun","description":"Smooth and carefully designed with ramped access to the Sway Fun allows those unable to leave their mobility device the ability to enjoy gentle swaying with no need to transfer.  Users can rock back and forth on the deck of the Sway Fun to get it moving, or a person stand on the outside of the Sway Fun and push it to get the equipment in motion. If you decide to not lock the wheels of your mobility device when riding, be sure to hold onto the handholds on the table on the deck of the Sway Fun. The sway Fun is in the shape of a boat.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[10.75,44.5],[12.75,46.4],[14,46],[14.25,44.5],[16.5,42.25],[15.25,40.75],[12.75,43],[11,43],[10.75,44.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Roller Table","looping_sound":"looping_rollerTable","short_sound":"short_rollerTable","intro_sound":"intro_rollerTable","description":"This is an entertaining spot to roll across. The roller table is a long horizontal surface at transfer height with metal cylinders that rotate.  The sensation of you get  lay on the table and roll across the table is excellent. People with visual impairments are recommended to be careful of the circular metal loops that are provided as handholds to pull oneself along the rolling table.  The circular metal loops are right above the rolling table, so be careful when raising your head.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[16,49.5],[17.5,50],[19,46],[18,45.5],[16,49.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Laser Harp","looping_sound":"looping_laserHarp","short_sound":"short_laserHarp","intro_sound":"intro_laserHarp","description":"The Magical Harp, created by artist Jen Lewin, is a permanent, outdoor motion sensitive instrument . Though the motion sensors are high overhead and out of reach, they can see you and detect your movements if you are standing directly under the arch. Much like plucking the string of a harp, passing through the beams triggers custom circuitry and sensors to produce musical notes. Users play to create an ambiance that is individual to the moment of interaction that reflects the broad idea of play thatâ€™s still fun and sophisticated. When crowds flock to it and people start to play independently, the groupâ€™s participation in a musical symphony. For more information on this remarkable and innovative installation, please visit CODA Works, where the Magical Harp won a 2016 CODA Award.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[22,48],[22.5,49.5],[28,46],[27,44.5],[22,48]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Bench","looping_sound":"looping_bench","short_sound":"short_bench","intro_sound":"intro_bench","description":"","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[29.75,53],[30.5,53.25],[31.25,51.75],[30.5,51.5],[29.75,53]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Cozy Coccoon","looping_sound":"looping_cozyCoccoon","short_sound":"short_cozyCoccoon","intro_sound":"intro_cozyCoccoon","description":"The Cozy Cocoon is a place for kids and adults, especially those with autism and sensory challenges, to hang out in when active play feels overwhelming and frenetic. The Cozy Cocoon in the Spin Zone is one of three located throughout the playground. A Cozy Cocoon is shaped like a large sphere with openings. There is one large opening in the front with room for one person to sit down in the cocoon, and there are smaller openings in the side and back of each cocoon to use as  a window to peer out at the playground.  The cocoon can be gently rotated so that the user or a helper can  rotate it away from the action and noise. A cocoon's main purpose is to be a calming, cozy place to regroup while observing from the round openings in the cocoon and to re-emerge and re-engage in active play when ready.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[24,52.5],[24,54],[25.5,54],[25.5,52.5],[24,52.5]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Stairs To Slides","looping_sound":"looping_stairsToSlides","short_sound":"short_stairsToSlides","intro_sound":"intro_stairsToSlides","description":"A staircase of 15 stairs is provided to the south of the summit of the slide mound.  Caution, the end of the railing at the base of the stairs protrudes into the walking path.  The railing on the stairs has two heights.  A narrow fence opening is at the top of the slide that prevents mobility devices from accidentally rolling down the stairs.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[35,42],[36,44],[40,42],[39,40],[35,42]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Turf Slide","looping_sound":"looping_turfSlide","short_sound":"short_turfSlide","intro_sound":"intro_turfSlide","description":"Two turf hills are located on the slide mound and are very fun to slide on.  One section of turf is located to the south east of the slide mound summit between the roller slide and the stairs. The other section of artificial turf is located to the west of the group slide.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[33,39],[35,42],[39,40],[39,39],[34,37],[33,39]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Turf Slide","looping_sound":"looping_turfSlide","short_sound":"short_turfSlide","intro_sound":"intro_turfSlide","description":"Two turf hills are located on the slide mound and are very fun to slide on.  One section of turf is located to the south east of the slide mound summit between the roller slide and the stairs. The other section of artificial turf is located to the west of the group slide.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[47,37],[43,39],[43,40],[47,41],[48,40],[48,38],[47,37]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Roller Slide","looping_sound":"looping_rollerSlide","short_sound":"short_rollerSlide","intro_sound":"intro_rollerSlide","description":"The roller slide is a series of horizontal metal cylinders that  rotate underneath the rider to provide a bumpy and stimulating experience. The slide goes down at a moderate incline, flattens out, and then goes down another incline. The bottom platform, also known as the Dignity Landing, gives people that need the assistance of a helper a safe place to wait at the end of the slide without blocking others.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[40,38],[34,35],[34,37],[39,39],[40,38]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Dignity Landing","looping_sound":"looping_dignityLanding","short_sound":"short_dignityLanding","intro_sound":"intro_dignityLanding","description":"There is no description for this item","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[32,35],[33,37],[34,35],[32,35]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Climbing Loops","looping_sound":"looping_climbingLoops","short_sound":"short_climbingLoops","intro_sound":"intro_climbingLoops","description":"The Climbing Loops offer another fun way to get to the top of the slide mound, and offer creative secure hand holds for those needing to climb more carefully. 13 metal loops are mounted at various places up in incline of the slide mound just due west of the slide mound summit. For people with VI is is recommended to use a cane to sense the location of the climbing loops when ascending with the climbing loops. .","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[38,32],[34,35],[40,38],[41,37],[40,36],[42,33],[38,32]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Twisty Slide","looping_sound":"looping_twistySlide","short_sound":"short_twistySlide","intro_sound":"intro_twistySlide","description":"Our classic curved slide  is made of plastic and has higher curved sides for added security and offers a slower sliding experience.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[35.75,37.25],[36,36.25],[37,35],[37,34],[36.5,33.5],[37.5,33],[38,34.5],[38,35.5],[37.25,36.5],[36.75,37.25],[35.75,37.25]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Group Slide","looping_sound":"looping_groupSlide","short_sound":"short_groupSlide","intro_sound":"intro_groupSlide","description":"The Group Slide enables two or three people to slide down simultaneously, perfect for those needing additional assistance or just the added fun of sliding with your friend next to you! The slide is metal so be careful on hot days. This slide is the fastest and most slippery slide at the playground.","type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[38,37.75],[38.75,38.75],[42.5,36.25],[41.5,35.25],[38,37.75]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Left Edge of the Playground","looping_sound":null,"short_sound":"short_hit","intro_sound":null,"passable":false,"type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[0,0],[0,62],[-10,62],[-10,0],[0,0]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Top Edge of the Playground","looping_sound":null,"short_sound":"short_hit","intro_sound":null,"passable":false,"type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[0,62],[76,62],[76,72],[0,72],[0,62]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Right Edge of the Playground","looping_sound":null,"short_sound":"short_hit","intro_sound":null,"passable":false,"type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[76,62],[76,0],[86,0],[86,62],[76,62]]],"type":"Polygon"}},{"type":"Feature","properties":{"name":"Bottom Edge of the Playground","looping_sound":null,"short_sound":"short_hit","intro_sound":null,"passable":false,"type":"object"},"geometry":{"coordinates":[[[0,0],[76,0],[76,-10],[0,-10],[0,0]]],"type":"Polygon"}}],"coordinateSystem":{"type":"custom","stepSize":1}}

properties.name: Stepping Sounds
properties.description: The stepping sounds are a permanent installation placed at the main entrance to the playground. The stepping sounds make different sounds as users walk in front of hidden sensors placed along the side of the walkway. There are several different sounds including water and squeaky shoes.

properties.name: Disk Spinner
properties.description: The disk spinner may seem like a basic spinner, but of all the spinners at Magical Bridge it can offer the most thrilling and challenging spinning experience. The disk spinner almost looks like an enormous thumbtack that isnâ€™t put in the ground perfectly straight.   The disk is around 5 feet in diameter.    On one side it is 1 foot off the ground and on the highest side it is 3 feet off the ground. So not only will you rotate when you are on the disk spinner, but you will go up and down. Users can sit or lay on the disk, or for a more challenging adventure, stand on the disk and rotate it by walking. The disk spinner is 12 inches high on one side, which is a bit high to transfer from a wheelchair so it would be good to have some assistance to do it.  Even those who canâ€™t move much or at all could be lifted and placed on the disk spinner for an enjoyable spin ride.

properties.name: Ground Carousel
properties.description: The Ground Carousel is flush with the ground so everyone can ride. For those who are blind or with other challenging visual impairments, approach the ground carousel with caution.  The ground carousel has metal poles that can come around very fast and sometimes people spin with their legs and arms extended out from the carousel. So best if you are visually impaired to ask folks to stop the 1carousel before approaching it.  The carousel has two benches for up to 3 people each to sit on while riding the carousel and also has two magical parking spaces for wheelchairs. To transfer a wheelchair onto the ground carousel simply lift the safety rail, roll into the space provided and park the wheelchair.  Set the safety break on the wheelchair, then bring the safety rail down. If you have the arm strength to do it, you can â€œturnâ€ the disk in the middle of the spinner which will cause the whole carousel to rotate.

properties.name: Net Spinner
properties.description: The Net Spinner is a combined climbing experience and a spinning experience. The structure of the Net Spinner is a large cone shaped net.  The net is anchored at the bottom to a large horizontal disk about 8 feet in diameter and about 1 foot from the ground.  Coming up from the center of the disk is pole that is 12 feet.  A network of ropes is attached from the top of the pole to the outside edge of the disks to form a net that can be climbed on.  A person standing next to the net spinner can push on the ropes in a circular direction causing the entire net spinner to rotate. Many people can climb on the net or sit safely on the disk inside at once. Not only is the net spinner a climbing challenge but you will get some good stimulus to your balance (vestibular) system if someone rotates the net spinning while you are at the top. Keep in mind the whole thing can spin as you are at a height of 8 or more feet off the ground. How do you know if you are ready to climb to the top of the net spinner?  People should be comfortable with climbing short distances up and down the net before going to the top.

properties.name: Nest Spinner
properties.description: The Nest Spinner is a relaxing spin ride where one or two people curl up safely into the nest and spin slowly and rhythmically making it a good introduction to spinning for those who would find it challenging.  The structure of the Nest Spinner looks like two large rings that are both crossed in space and connected together (be careful not to bump your head on the rings).  The base of the two rings has a cupped area which is big enough for two people to sit and a constant push on the sides of the rings to cause the nest to rotate.

properties.name: Cozy Coccoon
properties.description: The Cozy Cocoon is a place for kids and adults, especially those with autism and sensory challenges, to hang out in when active play feels overwhelming and frenetic. The Cozy Cocoon in the Spin Zone is one of three located throughout the playground. A Cozy Cocoon is shaped like a large sphere with openings. There is one large opening in the front with room for one person to sit down in the cocoon, and there are smaller openings in the side and back of each cocoon to use as  a window to peer out at the playground.  The cocoon can be gently rotated so that the user or a helper can  rotate it away from the action and noise. A cocoon's main purpose is to be a calming, cozy place to regroup while observing from the round openings in the cocoon and to re-emerge and re-engage in active play when ready.

properties.name: Long Ramp
properties.description: The long ramp is around 90 feet long. It goes along the bottom edge of the playground. It starts at avas bridge and ends at the creak bridge.

properties.name: Creek Bridge
properties.description: The creak bridge is the entrance from Mitchel park and exits on the right side in front of the tennis courts. The bridge goes over Adobe creak which flows around the edges of the playground.

properties.name: Rock Benches
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Performance Area
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Chess Table
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Chess Table
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Chess Table
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Play House First Floor
properties.description: The playhouse is a wooden structure with 2 levels. The first floor has a cafe in the top right corner and a set of work tools in the bottom right corner. The first floor has an opening on the right side to the stage.

properties.name: Kinder Bells
properties.description: Kinder bells are a series of bells that one can ring by pulling rapidly on the rope handles.  Each rope hands has a golf ball attached which serves as a striker to ring the bells. The bells are attached to an ornamental metal structure that looks like stems and leaves and the bells themselves look like large flowers.

properties.name: Climbing Giraffe
properties.description: The Climbing Giraffe is a small structure perfect for toddlers.  It has tactile elements, a short climbing net and bench designed to be climbed on and under. The structure looks like a Giraffe with its neck curved to the ground.

properties.name: Rocking Horse
properties.description: A very short rocking horse for toddlers. Be careful and use your cane as the rocking horse is about 2 feet high.

properties.name: Cozy Coccoon
properties.description: The Cozy Cocoon is a place for kids and adults, especially those with autism and sensory challenges, to hang out in when active play feels overwhelming and frenetic. The Cozy Cocoon in the Spin Zone is one of three located throughout the playground. A Cozy Cocoon is shaped like a large sphere with openings. There is one large opening in the front with room for one person to sit down in the cocoon, and there are smaller openings in the side and back of each cocoon to use as  a window to peer out at the playground.  The cocoon can be gently rotated so that the user or a helper can  rotate it away from the action and noise. A cocoon's main purpose is to be a calming, cozy place to regroup while observing from the round openings in the cocoon and to re-emerge and re-engage in active play when ready.

properties.name: Walking Machine
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Exercise Bike
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Bucket Swings
properties.description: Bucket and Disk Swings are supportive, allowing for use by all abilities, and promote collaborative swinging.  The bucket swings have a rigid plastic harness with a metal latching mechanism to keep the rider secure when swinging.  The harness hinges are located near the rider shoulders and the whole harness rotates overhead.  Be careful to not hit your head on the harness when getting in and out of the bucket swings.

properties.name: Disk Swings
properties.description: Bucket and Disk Swings are supportive, allowing for use by all abilities, and promote collaborative swinging. The disk swing is an entertaining spot for you to  relax and be swung. It is recommended that people, especially with visual impairments, be careful of their heads. The disk swing is a disk that fits several people and can be pushed back and forth.

properties.name: Sway Fun
properties.description: Smooth and carefully designed with ramped access to the Sway Fun allows those unable to leave their mobility device the ability to enjoy gentle swaying with no need to transfer.  Users can rock back and forth on the deck of the Sway Fun to get it moving, or a person stand on the outside of the Sway Fun and push it to get the equipment in motion. If you decide to not lock the wheels of your mobility device when riding, be sure to hold onto the handholds on the table on the deck of the Sway Fun. The sway Fun is in the shape of a boat.

properties.name: Roller Table
properties.description: This is an entertaining spot to roll across. The roller table is a long horizontal surface at transfer height with metal cylinders that rotate.  The sensation of you get  lay on the table and roll across the table is excellent. People with visual impairments are recommended to be careful of the circular metal loops that are provided as handholds to pull oneself along the rolling table.  The circular metal loops are right above the rolling table, so be careful when raising your head.

properties.name: Laser Harp
properties.description: The Magical Harp, created by artist Jen Lewin, is a permanent, outdoor motion sensitive instrument . Though the motion sensors are high overhead and out of reach, they can see you and detect your movements if you are standing directly under the arch. Much like plucking the string of a harp, passing through the beams triggers custom circuitry and sensors to produce musical notes. Users play to create an ambiance that is individual to the moment of interaction that reflects the broad idea of play thatâ€™s still fun and sophisticated. When crowds flock to it and people start to play independently, the groupâ€™s participation in a musical symphony. For more information on this remarkable and innovative installation, please visit CODA Works, where the Magical Harp won a 2016 CODA Award.

properties.name: Cozy Coccoon
properties.description: The Cozy Cocoon is a place for kids and adults, especially those with autism and sensory challenges, to hang out in when active play feels overwhelming and frenetic. The Cozy Cocoon in the Spin Zone is one of three located throughout the playground. A Cozy Cocoon is shaped like a large sphere with openings. There is one large opening in the front with room for one person to sit down in the cocoon, and there are smaller openings in the side and back of each cocoon to use as  a window to peer out at the playground.  The cocoon can be gently rotated so that the user or a helper can  rotate it away from the action and noise. A cocoon's main purpose is to be a calming, cozy place to regroup while observing from the round openings in the cocoon and to re-emerge and re-engage in active play when ready.

properties.name: Stairs To Slides
properties.description: A staircase of 15 stairs is provided to the south of the summit of the slide mound.  Caution, the end of the railing at the base of the stairs protrudes into the walking path.  The railing on the stairs has two heights.  A narrow fence opening is at the top of the slide that prevents mobility devices from accidentally rolling down the stairs.

properties.name: Turf Slide
properties.description: Two turf hills are located on the slide mound and are very fun to slide on.  One section of turf is located to the south east of the slide mound summit between the roller slide and the stairs. The other section of artificial turf is located to the west of the group slide.

properties.name: Turf Slide
properties.description: Two turf hills are located on the slide mound and are very fun to slide on.  One section of turf is located to the south east of the slide mound summit between the roller slide and the stairs. The other section of artificial turf is located to the west of the group slide.

properties.name: Roller Slide
properties.description: The roller slide is a series of horizontal metal cylinders that  rotate underneath the rider to provide a bumpy and stimulating experience. The slide goes down at a moderate incline, flattens out, and then goes down another incline. The bottom platform, also known as the Dignity Landing, gives people that need the assistance of a helper a safe place to wait at the end of the slide without blocking others.

properties.name: Dignity Landing
properties.description: There is no description for this item

properties.name: Climbing Loops
properties.description: The Climbing Loops offer another fun way to get to the top of the slide mound, and offer creative secure hand holds for those needing to climb more carefully. 13 metal loops are mounted at various places up in incline of the slide mound just due west of the slide mound summit. For people with VI is is recommended to use a cane to sense the location of the climbing loops when ascending with the climbing loops. .

properties.name: Twisty Slide
properties.description: Our classic curved slide  is made of plastic and has higher curved sides for added security and offers a slower sliding experience.

properties.name: Group Slide
properties.description: The Group Slide enables two or three people to slide down simultaneously, perfect for those needing additional assistance or just the added fun of sliding with your friend next to you! The slide is metal so be careful on hot days. This slide is the fastest and most slippery slide at the playground.
